brainly_data.question: Use part 1 of the fundamental theorem of calculus to find the derivative of the function. f(x) = 0 x 4 + sec(2t) dt hint: 0 x 4 + sec(2t) dt = − x 0 4 + sec(2t) dt
brainly_data.subject: Mathematics

all_answers.text:
Terrible formatting. 0 x 4? What does that mean? - x 0 4? Nobody can read that. I can't even tell what the integral is.

Is 0 x 4 supposed to mean ?
